# discord_emoji (Data Source)

Retrieves a Discord custom emoji. Can be looked up by ID or by name and guild ID.

## Example Usage

```terraform
terraform {
  required_providers {
    discord = {
      source  = "tfstack/discord"
      version = "~> 0.1"
    }
  }
}

provider "discord" {}

# Look up emoji by ID
data "discord_emoji" "by_id" {
  emoji_id = "1452601985235816601" # Replace with your emoji ID
  guild_id = "1452601985235816601" # Replace with your guild ID
}

# Look up emoji by name
data "discord_emoji" "by_name" {
  name     = "custom_emoji"
  guild_id = "1452601985235816601" # Replace with your guild ID
}

output "emoji_by_id" {
  value = data.discord_emoji.by_id
}

output "emoji_by_name" {
  value = data.discord_emoji.by_name
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Optional

- `emoji_id` (String) The ID of the emoji to retrieve. Either this or (name + guild_id) must be provided.
- `guild_id` (String) The ID of the guild (server) where the emoji is located. Must be provided along with name if emoji_id is not specified.
- `name` (String) The name of the emoji. Must be provided along with guild_id if emoji_id is not specified.

### Read-Only

- `animated` (Boolean) Whether the emoji is animated.
- `available` (Boolean) Whether the emoji is available for use.
- `id` (String) The ID of the emoji.
- `managed` (Boolean) Whether the emoji is managed by an integration.
- `require_colons` (Boolean) Whether the emoji requires colons to be used.
- `roles` (List of String) List of role IDs that can use this emoji. Empty if available to all roles.
- `user` (String) The ID of the user who created the emoji.
